instrupy.radiometer_model.ConicalScan¶

class instrupy.radiometer_model.ConicalScan(offNadirAngle=None, clockAngleRange=None, interScanOverheadTime=None, _id=None)[source]¶
Class to handle conical scan.

For illustration of off-nadir angle and clock angles see Fig.7 in T. Kawanishi et al., “The Advanced Microwave Scanning Radiometer for the Earth Observing System (AMSR-E), NASDA’s contribution to the EOS for global energy and water cycle studies,” in IEEE Transactions on Geoscience and Remote Sensing, vol. 41, no. 2, pp. 184-194, Feb. 2003, doi: 10.1109/TGRS.2002.808331.

Variables

  • offNadirAngle (float) – Off-nadir angle (i.e. the half-cone angle of the conical scan) in degrees.

  • clockAngleRange (float) – Scan clock angle range in degrees.

  • interScanOverheadTime – Time in seconds taken from ending current scan to starting next scan. Significant in case of mechanical scanning.

The following default values are assigned to the object instance parameters in case of None values or missing key/value pairs in the input dictionary.

Default values¶

Parameter

Default Value

interScanOverheadTime

0
Variables

_id (str or int) – Unique identifier.
